bibl.note: This document is a letter written by Sam Smith to the Postmaster General on January 18, 1825. Smith instructs the Postmaster General to forward the mail of Armour & Lake, two merchants, to their new residence in Jackson, Madison County, Tennessee.

div.p:
I am advised by Messrs Messeiurs
Armour & Lake that their residence is Jackson Madison County Tennessee and by their request I must ask the favour favor to have have any letters returned from this office as dead letters with their address forwarded to that place

If any they are to be found among the letters forwarded for the quarter ending the first of July or October and I am believe there was one returned the the teller at 1 Oct October
â€” they are merchants & express some anxiety to me I have put their address at foot
